"By clarifying our individual roles, we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead." Page said Eric Schmidt had done an outstanding job leading Google for the last decade. The results speak for themselves. The news surprised and worried Google observers. "The executive change is very much unexpected, and somewhat of a concern to investors," said Clayton Moran, an analyst at Benchmark Co..

The BBC's political editor Nick Robinson said Mr Oliver had no previous political involvement but had been approached by Mr Andy Coulson and had met the prime minister over the weekend. Mr Oliver said: I'm delighted and privileged to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time. "My background is broadcasting, but I know that newpapers play a crucial role and I look forward to talking with them.
